String.val: When Rick takes damage, parts of his body are destroyed. The power of the mask will slowly regenerate those lost body parts.
Kill enemies to gain Necro energy and fill the Mask Meter. Brutal kills release additional Necro.
To go Berserk, collect enough Necro and hold down the $BTN_L1 button.
When the Mask Meter is maxed out, press $BTN_L1 to unleash Berserker.
To block an enemy attack, hold $BTN_R1.
To traverse chasms use $LSTICK to highlight the desired Jump Node and press $BTN_FACE_DOWN.
Teratoid can enrage those around them to fight harder.
Break open containers to find hidden rewards.
Look for spikes hidden in the environment and use them to your advantage.
Press $BTN_FACE_RIGHT to grab an enemy then hold $BTN_FACE_RIGHT to rip off its head.
You found a piece torn from Jen's pictures.
Use Splatter Siphon against enemies to regenerate health: $BTN_L2 + $BTN_FACE_RIGHT
Fill at least one segment of the Mask Meter to perform a Mask Move.
BLOOD is power. Feed the mask and unlock new killing techniques.
When an enemy is glowing red, press $BTN_FACE_RIGHT to perform a Splatterkill.
$BTN_FACE_RIGHT to grab, $BTN_FACE_RIGHT. Dismembered arms can be used as weapons.
$BTN_FACE_RIGHT to grab, then hold $BTN_FACE_UP and aim with $LSTICK.
$BTN_FACE_RIGHT to grab, then hold $BTN_FACE_UP and aim with $LSTICK.
Aim shotgun with $LSTICK and press $BTN_R2 to fire.
Grab an enemy and press $BTN_FACE_UP while facing toward a spike to impale them.
You can access the Skill Upgrade screen at anytime by pressing $BTN_SELECT.
When Mask Meter is maxed, press $BTN_L1 to initiate Berserker.

That's right, take it in Rickâ€¦
That's right Ricky-boy; take it in baby!
(crazed eating noises)Man, that's good eating. You want some? Just kidding. Life is good.
Ah shit - AB, fuck me! Gives you that taste like you're chewing Aluminum foil.
Hand me that gland will ya?
Let me go baby, let me go!
Set me free why don't ya babe!
Help me to fuckin' help you.
Aw yeah; now that is the stuff.
Quiet Rick - This is big-boy time.
You blew it Rick-o. Now it's my turn.
Time to kick it old school!
Oh my! You assholes are in trouble now aren'tcha?
You know that went by WAY too fast!
Was it good for you too?
You know I needed that - no shit.
You know I wish I fuckin' smokedâ€¦
Oh god that feels better man!
What? You frightened you can't handle me?
Just say the word Rick, say the word.
Let it out Rick - unleash the beast.
That is some A-grade shit Rick.
Damn, you're in a rut huh?
Hey, you wanna try something new?
Lets show 'em what we can do!
Let's make a mess, what do you say?
His insides should be on the outside!
Ooooow, this is gonna be messy.
Having fun? I know I am.
I always wanted to do this.
Hey - want to see what your spine looks like?
You see that head come apart?
Let me put it like thisâ€¦
And then, we squeeze the jelly outâ€¦
Give up yet? Yeah? Do ya?
Nice action; after watching you work thatâ€¦
...I'm assuming you've spent a lot of lonely nights on the internet.
Save me a drumstick, will ya?
Necro; the power of the dead
Kill these guys and release more.
It's time for the big boys to play.
That ain't The Corrupted; they're groupies and wannabes.
Trust me; if that was the Corrupted your brain would be leaking out your nose right about now.
Right now I'm the baddest motherfucker in this universe; top dog. Let's keep it that way, what do ya think?
What is it with you Rick? Even the plants want to kill you.
Yeah. Not much for gardening, I guess.
Rick - I can feel it moving.
You kinda look like that wrestler guyâ€¦
There seems to be a gaping hole where the plot used to beâ€¦
Reality is falling apart like the plot of a bad videogame.

Ummâ€¦ no need to yell Rick-o; I'm right here inside your head, wrapped around your cerebellum. You think it; I hear it - same in reverse. You hear me, but no-one else does. Shhâ€¦ it's our little secret.
You don't believe I'm just here to help.
Love - that's sweet. Well I got an even better motivation - revengeâ€¦
That doesn't mean squat. Everything works by hidden rules, and when the eclipse happens, the rules change.
You do the right rituals, offer the right sacrifice and the door that was locked gets opened.
You hear me like this, 'cause I needed to talk to you in a voice your tiny little human brain would recognize.
I'm every badass motherfucker you ever crossed paths with - so just be glad I'm on your side.
Portal travel's like blowing a truck driver to get a ride; it gets you where you want to go, but it leaves you with a nasty taste in your mouth.
Portal travel - it's like smuggling a condom full of cocaine in your ass; you get a free ride out of it, but it's extremely uncomfortable.
Look at you Ricky-boy; growing up huh?
This is your best yet killer!
why did you let them take me?
why did you let them hurt me?
why did you let them kill me?
why did you let him take me?
why did you let him hurt me?
why did you let him kill me?
I want us to be together until the end of the world.
Let her go, you sick son of a bitch!
She can't hear you through the glass.
Jen's GOT to be somewhere in this direction. I can feel it!
Don't make this more painful than it has to be.
It's Jen; she must have left it for me to find.
It's Jen; she's leaving us a trail.
Rick, you lucky dog; she's a good-looking girl.
Cute couple; pity one of you is gonna end your day being ritually sacrificed.
Ricky's got a girlfriend, Ricky's got a girlfriend.
I can see why you're so fond of those - her, I meanâ€¦ her.
You took this? You've got a good eye Rick.
â€¦and she has a nice ass.
Hard to believe she used to be a man. It's the hands that give it away.
Hard to believe she used to be aâ€¦ oh, you didn't know?
Lameâ€¦ she's still got the skin on.
Lameâ€¦ she's still got the skin she was born in.
Oh wow, she's actually cute. I wonder what her skull looks like.
Hey, hey check out that dork over there. He's been staring at you since we sat down.
Hey! Why don't you take a picture? It'll last longer.
Oh my god! Did he just take a picture?
I've had it since I was a kid.
Nice. It's in pretty good condition; do you still have the box?
Csssht! This is Officer Willis, Dork Patrol, calling for backup!
Jen? You look so sad; what is it?
Promise me one thing; Promise me you'll never change.
Woah, how did you get that scar?
It was an accident, when I was a kid. It's nothing.
I like it; it makes you lookâ€¦ rugged.
Hey, check it out; the psycho's asleep.
There you are, hiding away again. You hear that? They're playing our song. Let's go dance.
Are you still sore because we didn't go see that horror movie? Tell you what - dance with me, and we'll go catch the midnight showing. Sound like a plan?
Look what I got. Backstage passes - access all areas. Ain't I the best? See? Writing for the college newspaper really does have its perks.
What do I want to be after college? Hmmâ€¦ I don't knowâ€¦ prize-winning journalistâ€¦
...hot fashion modelâ€¦ or maybe just Mrs. Rick Taylorâ€¦ That doesn't sound so bad.
Sure, every girl wants to date a rich, cool, hot-looking rock star.
But I'm not every girl. I've got you, remember?
I swear to God, you put this on the internet, and your ass is grass, buster.
Sometimes I think there must be some evil voice inside your head, Rick...
Six years? God, sometimes it feels like we've known each other forever.
Like in past lives, or something...
D'you hear about the stuff going on over at the medical school?
Some guy called West doing weird surgery on lab animals. I think there might be a story in it for the college paper...
Move in together? Oh, gee Rick. I don't know. It's a big step, and....
Of course I wanna do it! I've been waiting for you to ask for, like, forever!
C'mon. Wanna play big strong hero and damsel in distress?
Not keeping you from your studies, am I?
Thought you had a paper to finish for tomorrow...
You ever wonder what it'd be like to actually be a character in a horror movie?
I'd probably just have to scream a lot and show off my ass...
When we're old, how are we gonna tell our grandkids...
...our first date together was to an all-night splatter movie marathon?
I had this freaky dream last night. I was trapped someplace far awayâ€¦
...but I knew you would come and rescue me. Weird, huh?
Just for you, Rick-o. I'm yours, and no-one else's.
We have to stay together, Rick Taylor.
We're like some pair of sick and twisted soul-mate freaks!
Hey, you hear about that eclipse rock festival at the Arkham Bowl?
Get two tickets for it, and you'll be my hero forever.
you want to come with me to West Mansion? Awww, that's so sweet. You're gonna protect me?
My hero; come here and get your reward.
I'm warning you, I got this whole dark side you haven't seen yet.
This is Jennifer Willis reporting from the anthropology department of Miskatonic Universityâ€¦
...on the trail of the geek in his natural habitat.
There - you see it? Ohhhh... it's a real ugly one. Quiet, let's move closer...
Oh hey Jen; you want to take a look at this bone? It's over two thousand years old.
And so, unable to reproduce, the geeks died out.
Oh my god! Is that Tom Savini!?
God, you're the only person I've ever met who gets red-eye in natural light.
Is this my dream or yours?
I've had a thousand faces, but always the same endâ€¦
I've lived a thousand lives, and they always end here.
This has happened before - this has all happened before.
They all die in the end.
I don't need you Rick - you're a puppet, a toy.
I'm keeping you around for my own amusement.
Right now I ain't that amused.
You want to test me? Then lets goâ€¦
You want to try and fight me for it? This should be goodâ€¦
This is my body now - you're just along for the ride.
I'm the organ grinder, you are just my monkey.
Looking for the key? It's blood, Rick; it's always blood.
Oh no - no, no, no Rick; you are staying right here.
Where there's life there's blood; and I need blood.
Take his pulseâ€¦ and KEEP it.
You see any fat ladies fuckin' singing? I don't think soâ€¦
There's no going back now Rick.
It's too late to turn backâ€¦
You're not trying to back out on me?
You trying to back out on me?
Where do you think you're going?
In the Shadow of the Abyss
From the journal of Doctor Henry West - Arkham, 1756
Was it only four years ago that I first stepped ashore at Boston harbor, with my beloved bride Leonora at my side? She is dead now, taken by cholera.
These surgeon's hands saved hundreds in the outbreak that swept through the colonies, yet I failed to prevent the death of my own wife. Tonight, God willing, I will join her.
To take one's own life is a mortal sin. But perhaps I can lead His hand. Poison shall be my nepenthe.
I leave my estate to the people of Arkham. This mansion has become a house of horror; in time may it become known as a place of healing, and stand as a memorial to her beauty and grace.
It seems the good Lord is not yet ready to accept me, nor to forgive my sins. As I lay at the threshold to the eternal abyss an angel spoke to me, his face a mask of serenity.
His message - "Elle ne doit pas mourir."
I returned from that dark place with knowledge of a means by which to arrest time's advances upon the flesh and the promise that, god willing, science might one day restore Leonora to life.
My rational mind tells me it was a delusion born of the Laudanum, nothing more and yetâ€¦ and yet the apparition had spoken the truth.
She lies perfectly preserved now, serene as if sleeping, like some princess in a Grimm tale. She shall sleep enough for the both of us; I must go to work.
From the journal of Doctor Henry West - Boston, 1777
The war against the British continues. General Washington hails me a hero, and credits me with saving the lives of many of his troops, through my skills as a surgeon.
All that matters, though, is the knowledge I can glean from the shattered and bloody bodies that are laid out before me on this table.
They will be the text books from which I will learn the secrets of life and death.
I have learned so much in the last twenty years of study, but my beloved Leonora remains perfect but lifeless, while I continue to age.
I fear that the secrets I seek will not be easily discovered in the span of one normal human lifetime.â€¦
From the journal of Doctor Henry West - Mid-Atlantic, 1784
I have exhausted all possible sources of knowledge in the fledging nation of these new United States.

With the limited resources available to me in the Americas, I have already achieved some small success in my experiments into the reanimation of dead matter, a scientific discipline that I have come to call Necrobiology.

It is my belief that further advances may be made through close study of some of the knowledge contained within the countless libraries and universities of Europe, for I think that this may not be a new science at all, but a very old one; one previously dismissed as necromancy.
I leave my beloved Leonora behind me, preserved in a catacomb beneath a large plot of land I have purchased outside Arkham. She will remain there, safe and hidden until I return.
From the journal of Doctor Henry West - Edinburgh, 1789

At last, a breakthrough! After scouring Europe in search of the crumbs of knowledge I required, I found the last few vital pieces I needed here in Edinburgh, where I first studied to be a physician decades ago.

What I have found is not a means of restoring life, but of prolonging it. Armed with this new knowledge, I will be able to extend my life far beyond its natural limit, allowing me to work tirelessly to achieve my goal!
From the journal of Doctor Henry West - Paris, 1794
Wherever I go, I am driven out, pursued by angry mobs and rumors of witchcraft and murder. These ignorant fools! It is not witchcraft I practice, but science. And does not science require sacrifice?
From the journal of Doctor Henry West - Waterloo, 1815
War again, as the Great European Powers take to the field against each other again.

I care not for the petty squabbles of nations and conquerors. All that matters is the work, and the advancement of my knowledge of the frailties of human flesh, and the ways in which it can be surgically altered and improved upon.

Surgery is the key to the restoration of life, I feel sure of it now. A few more decades, a few more wars, and my scalpel blade will finally cut through to find the secret knowledge that I know is hidden within these maimed and bloody forms.
From the journal of Doctor Henry West - Arkham
It is time for Henry West MD to leave Arkham once more. I have been here too long, and rumors are beginning to circulate, drawing attention to my apparently un-ageing appearance.

I have already laid the groundwork for my eventual return. A nephew has been mentioned. Howard Philips West. A surgeon and man of science, like myself. A decade or two from now, he will come to Arkham to claim the inheritance left to him by his now late uncle.
I leave my beloved Leonora resting in the secret place within the chapel I have built for her, where I know she will patiently await my return.
From the journal of Doctor Henry West - The Crimean Peninsula, 1854
Europe is at war again, providing me with more surgical fodder for my work. Humanity concerns itself with death.
I am concerned with life, with reversing the effects of death and restoring my beloved Leonora to my side, with conquering death itself.
From the journal of Doctor Henry West - Georgia, 1864
Arkham is a distant memory and my image of Leonora has grown indistinct, yet still I can vividly recall the scent of her hair, and the warmth of her lips. I know she waits for me still.
Almost a century has passed since I began my search. I have seen wars, famine, empires rise and fall, and so much suffering.
My experiences have led me to explore realms I would once have dismissed as superstition and fancy. Now at last my journey is over; At last I have the means to restore my beloved to life!
I return to West Mansion and my love; the house shall soon be alive once more with the infectious sound of Leonora's joyful laughter.
Disaster! All has been in vain; I am a fool. Leonora has returned a ghoulish, screeching, drooling thing.
She watches without seeing, through blind eyes older than time. I keep her restrained for her own benefit.
In rare moments of lucidity she is herself again, and begs that I set her free.
It is a ruse, as I have already learned to my cost. Yet perversely these fleeting instances give me cause for hope. We're close, my love; so close.
I must go; she is hungry.
Leonora slipped her chains once more last night. I found her at dawn on the outskirts of Arkham, her face blooded, her beautiful ivory wedding gown stained black with goreâ€¦
â€¦and this time, clutched tightly in her hands, were the shattered remains of a porcelain doll.
From the journal of Doctor Henry West- Cambridge, 1866
What devilry is this? I have been sent to Cambridge on a wild-goose chase by Arkham's magistrate.
The patient did not keep our appointment, his house is deserted. Two days of travel have been for naught.
I cannot shake this dread feeling deep in my heart that something is terribly amiss.
Six o'clock; too exhausted to sleep. The sun rises, today as every other. Yet something has forever changed. I feel not its warm embrace.
I cannot yet make sense of this madness. I write this account of last night only to convince myself of its irrevocable outcome. My heart is deadâ€¦
I reached Arkham at nightfall. As my horse 'Providence' crested the ridge that overlooks this estate I witnessed a chilling scene, and the purpose of this fool's errand became clearâ€¦
Towering over the mansion stood a sacrificial Wickerman, crudely fashioned.
Even at distance I could make out the mob, and the flailing figure of a woman dressed in an ivory gown trussed and borne on their shoulders.
A jury of the great and the good of Arkham town had already pronounced judgment. Their intent was plainâ€¦
â€¦Leonora was to be burned as a witch.I rode with hasteâ€¦
As I rode a cacophony of jeers and cries and such screaming reached my ears, and I grimly observed that the good Christian folk of Arkham town have not entirely abandoned their pagan roots.
Cowardsâ€¦ How quickly man will revert to superstition in dealing with matters he does not understand.
I prayed for help to any God that would listen; but it was not our Lord that answeredâ€¦
I could not say what fate befell that mob; only that their shouting and jeering turned to screams and then a strange inhuman moaning that chilled my blood.
In that garden last night I did bear witness to a succession of events I can scarcely believe, though they did happen.
Before the Wickerman stood a masked brute, drawn straight from the pages
of some lurid penny dreadful.And thenâ€¦In her own voice Leonora cried out to me!
In a ghastly parody of life that rough-hewn effigy did begin to moveâ€¦ Groaning, creaking like the gates of hell!
The brute began to scale that tumbledown colossus, and with inhuman strength did he tear apart the Wickermanâ€¦
I used my talents only to serve mankind. My reward is ruination. So be it.
All that remains of my wife are memories and her wedding ring. In time both will tarnish.
Science has failed me. Humanity is a luxury I can no longer afford; I shall put my faith in older gods.
I will tear down the gates of heaven to find you Leonora, and I shall reach them on a stairway built from the stacked corpses of the good people of Arkham!
And the body of her masked executioner shall form the final step.
From the journal of Doctor Henry West - Arkham
All is not lost. There are greater forces in this universe than science and so-called reason.

In my researches into the obscure arcana buried away in the furthest corners of human learning, I have come across hints of them many times before. Always, I dismissed them as superstitious nonsense, but no more.

Artificially-induced longevity of my own lifespan. The reanimation of dead matter. Gross surgical alterations of the human form. All these things would be dismissed as impossible, and yet all these things I know to be possible.
From the journal of Doctor Henry West - Arkham
The secrets are there, if you know where to look. To find them, you need wealth - a great deal of wealth - and time to spend decades in patient searching.
Fortunately, I had both in abundance. I travelled the world. I filled my home with the curios and books I collected. Most of it was useless, but I enough of it would provide me with what I needed.
From the journal of Doctor Henry West - Peru, 1923

The world is filled with secret voices. They talk to us from ancient books, from artifacts stolen from tombs, from the hieroglyphics carved into the walls of lost and secret temples. I listened to them all. Finally, after decades of waiting, I found the right one to unlock the knowledge I sought.
From the Journal of Dr. Henry West - en route, 1925
The Southern Americas have proven to be fertile grounds for my research, and we set sail from To-loom well-laden with the arcane relics of religions long-dead.
I sense I am being steered by some invisible force, more powerful than the wind and the tides.
Two days ago, just north of Puerto Rico and in an unnatural fog, the ship was dashed against rocks and wrecked.
I awoke on the shores of this lonely atoll. Where? I cannot say; the constellations in the night sky are not those I learned as a child.
It is a strange place, desolate, eerie; like home.
It would seem that I am the solitary survivor of the wreck; yet I am not alone here.
Even now in the darkness I hear their dreadful, ceaseless chant; La! La! Kuh-thoo-loo ff-tag-en!

Periodically the island is ravaged by fierce storms. In the days that follow seafarers from eras long past are washed ashore, while the wreckage of flying machines from some distant future lies strewn across the landscape.
In this place yesterday, tomorrow and forever after exist together in the here and now.
At sites throughout the island the air crackles with an unknowable energy, jagged as broken glass; it in these places that the fabric of reality has worn most thin. But worn thin by what?

From cannibalized mechanical parts I have devised a system of relays stretching across this island with a mind to harnessing this energy, perhaps to exploit the unique properties of this place for my own ends.
No doubt this climate is treacherous, yet those marooned here face more immediate dangers.
The island's inhabitants hunt them down, tirelessly and with grim delight. With each sacrifice my instruments measure a surge of some dark power.
Those that evade capture are slowly changed; corrupted. I alone am spared.
I have penetrated the inner sanctum of the Thule Temple. At its center stands a golden sarcophagus, Aztec in origin; radiant, glorious.
It seems strangely familiar - as if from a dream of long ago. It intrigues me; one could say it calls to me. I should like to study it further.
This day I have made contact with the island's indigenous inhabitants. It is as if I had been expected.
They are men of the sea; slimy, grotesque. Once, perhaps, they were human.
The Gods that came to my aid the night Leonora died are known to these creatures. They are their Masters; at last I shall learn their name.
From the journal of Doctor Henry West

The dead possess a hidden energy. This necrotic power - or 'necro energy' - is released at the moment of death, and can be harnessed by those with the power to see it. The Masters feed on it. Death is the source of their nourishment.
From the journal of Doctor Henry West, 1930
Doorways! Everywhere doorways, between here, there - and perhaps the hereafter.
I travel freely now, unencumbered by such trivial concepts as time and distance.
I channel limitless energy through these portals directly to West Mansion; and so my research continues.
From the journal of Doctor Henry West - City of Carcosa on the shores of lake Hali, constellation of Alderbaran

What wonders have been opened up to me now that the secrets of Portal travel are mine! I have sat in caverns deep beneath the earth and conversed in dead languages with the inhuman things that dwell there. I have stood on alien worlds and looked up at stars far different from our own. The hidden pathways of the universe are mine to command!
From the journal of Doctor Henry West

The Abyss. That is the name of the prison my Masters are trapped in. It is Elsewhere. Part of Overspace, a place far beyond human understanding. They have been there for longer than time can be measured, but it is written that they will return one day, when the stars are aligned. When they do, they will reward those who have aided their return.
The Dark Masters; at last I have found them. The energy required to create the smallest breech into the great void was immense; so much suffering, so many deaths.
No matter; something was let out, all tentacles and horns, immeasurably vast, awful. It is but the slightest projection of their form into this domain. It is the Lord Thule.
From the journal of Doctor Henry West
I return now to Arkham, to West Manor. I return too as another Henry West, nephew of the previous owner of West Mansion, and legal heir to all that was his.
From the journal of Doctor Henry West - Arkham

They are the Great Old Ones. The Many-Angled Ones. The Rulers of the Impossible Gulfs. The Masters of All That Is Seen and Unseen. They have a true name, though I only ever dare say it once, and never again. They are The Corrupted, and if I serve them faithfully they will give me what I want.
From the journal of Doctor Henry West - Arkham
The Masters were, the Masters are, and the Masters shall be. Not in the spaces we know, but between them, They exist, serene and primal, formless and to us unseen.
From the journal of Doctor Henry West
I have not always gone by my true name. In London, in 1888, I called myself Jack. I was bored, but soon found ways to keep myself amused.

Now I go by the name of Henry West again. Before that, I was Derleth West; before him, Randolph Carter West. Clark Ashton West, Howard Philips West, Charles Dexter West; so many different names, but all with the same face and purpose.
I like this modern world. So cold and impersonal. A pity it must all be destroyed.

I watch with amusement as mankind sends rockets and satellites into the cosmos. If they knew what else was out there, waiting for them, they would run and hide and never dare look up again.The human race are vermin, infesting the Earth while its true owners are absent. I will be the exterminator.
A travelling preacher once came to the mansion to spread the good word. I had him walled up alive in a sub-basement, and savored his screams like a fine wine.
From the journal of Doctor Henry West

To while away the years, and tap the youthful life energies of Miskatonic's student body, I have once again taken up a post at the university, the fourth time I have been a member of the faculty in the last hundred years. We Wests have always been at the forefront of the advancement of learning.
From the journal of Doctor Henry West - The Arctic, 1951
The greatest discovery of all. An ice palace, built beneath the polar wastes! A cathedral to the glories of the Masters, founded upon the ruins of something far older!

It is all nothing more than a monument to grand folly, though. Those that built this place sought to use the Masters for their own ends. They were punished for their arrogance, while I will be rewarded for my faithful service.
There are places of power here on Earth that have known the touch of the Masters. They are few in number, and watched over by terrible guardians, but I must find them. Everything depends on it.
From the journal of Doctor Henry West

Despite my attempts to unlock its secrets, the Terror Mask continues to frustrate me. I thought I sensed a power within it, but perhaps it is no more than it appears to be - an unremarkable ceremonial bone mask. I return it to its place among my collection, and turn my attention to more important matters.
From the journal of Doctor Henry West - Arkham
I have consulted the texts I have so painstakingly collected. They say the secrets of the Abyss are contained within the pages of the Necronomicon.
By chance, a copy of that most infamous of books is kept under lock and key in the restricted section of Miskatonic University. Whatever the cost, I must have it.
From the journal of Doctor Henry West

My home has changed much since I first built it. New wings and floors have been added, hidden cellars and dungeons excavated, and out-buildings have grown up in the grounds around it. It has its secrets, and it has guardians to protect those secrets.
From the journal of Doctor Henry West - Arkham

Arkham is in uproar today. There was a break-in at the university library last night. A nightwatchman and some interfering fool of a librarian were killed, and a rare volume stolen, although the authorities refuse to name it. No matter. I now have what I need.
From the journal of Doctor Henry West
I have traveled through these portals to those remote and mystic places that have known the touch of the Masters.
Fools re-assure themselves that these places of horrors and wonders exist far from their own doorsteps, but the touch of the Corrupted is everywhere.

They are here, among us, if only we had eyes to see them. Look for them among the haunted and abandoned places of our everyday world, the places we instinctively shun, even if we do not know why. They are there. They are waiting for us.
From the journal of Doctor Henry West - Arkham, 1971
Last night, through ways too strange to easily relate here, I made direct contact with the Masters, and they made their Divine Will known to me.
It will take years to plan, and decades more to implement, but time is something I have no shortage of. Their Will shall be done.
From the journal of Doctor Henry West

How many days have I sat in the mansion's chapel? First of all it was the resting place of my beloved Leonora, then it became a place of communion with the Masters. So many ways to the secrets of my home intersect here. It is at the heart of everything I work for.
From the journal of Doctor Henry West - Arkham, 1976
I have made a Holy Covenant with the Rulers of the Impossible Gulfs. When the stars are right and the way has been prepared, I will open up a Gateway to allow them to escape their prison.
This world shall be theirs. In return, they will restore my Leonora to me.
Poets write of a love so strong that it shakes the world. The love that I bear will destroy it instead.
From the journal of Doctor Henry West
The Necronomicon speaks of a war in the Abyss, and a renegade that escaped. Weak, dying, it oozed through the cracks in reality and into this world. The Masters assure me these legends are lies.
From the journal of Doctor Henry West

The Masters put my scientific knowledge to good use. In my labs beneath the mansion, I create new forms of servant creatures for them, splicing together abominations and monstrosities. I build their armies for them, and they are grateful.
Problem: Subjects' screams disturb my concentration while I am working. Solution: Sew up the mouth or sever the vocal chords.
From the journal of Doctor Henry West

For every year I have spent in West Mansion, I have spent several more traveling the world in search of knowledge. I do not worry at leaving my home unoccupied for so long. The things that roam its grounds and lie in wait within its walls will deter any unwelcome guests.
I do not sleep. A side-effect of the longevity process. I lie in the darkness, and hear only the screams of my victims. It has been like this for more than 200 years now.
From the journal of Doctor Henry West

The Masters' true forms cannot exist in this world. They require host bodies, but what form, what kind of flesh is strong enough to contain the terrible power of their life forces? It will be the supreme challenge to build new bodies for them.
I remold flesh and resculpt bone. I create things both unnatural and wondrous. I enjoy my work.
I have seen hundreds - thousands, more likely - die before me on the surgeon's table. Their gods did not answer their babbling prayers. Mine will.
From the journal of Doctor Henry West
Humanity is doomed. I am convinced of that now. While mankind sleeps, the Masters and their servants grow in numbers and gather their strength.

They build their armies in readiness for the glorious day when the gates are opened and Those Who Wait In Darkness return to reclaim what has always been theirs. We are not the owners of the Earth. We are merely its unwelcome tenants.
From the journal of Doctor Henry West

The servants of the Masters are crude, bestial things. With one exception. It calls itself 'Biggy Man', and, although as savage as many of the others, is possessed by a primitive but cunning intelligence. The others fear it greatly, and, in my dealings with it, even I have felt wary of its tricks.
From the journal of Doctor Henry West
These creatures that are harvested for food here - what are they, I wonder? The remnants of some elder race? An offshoot of humanity itself? It doesn't matter.
They are merely Cattle; an appetizer to the main course. A foretaste of mankind's fate, once the Masters return.
The Masters of the Abyss reward those who serve them. Food is one such reward. I will be rewarded too. My beloved Leonora will be returned to me.
The Masters are patient, for after summer comes winter and after winter comes summer. They know their time will come again.
From the journal of Doctor Henry West

Host Body A's natural strength and size has been increased through surgical augmentation, making it powerful enough to contain the life essence of one of the Masters. Of course, the process has driven it violently insane, but living flesh is always easier to work with than dead.
From the journal of Doctor Henry West
It is more than thirty years since our Covenant was made, and still I wait. The places of power on the other side of the Portal-ways must be explored and prepared.
Intricate rituals must be conducted. The movements of the heavens must be observed, and still I wait. I am patient. I will have my reward.
Leonora and I were never blessed with children, but I think of all my creations as my children now. They play in the grounds of the mansion and make their lairs in its darkest corners.
The children grow restless and hungry. I must arrange for another student to visit me here at the mansion and keep them entertained.
From the journal of Doctor Henry West
Even after the rituals have been conducted and the heavens are in the correct alignment, a Sacrifice is needed.
Fate will provide the right victim, the Masters tell me. I will know the Sacrifice when I see them, they promise me.
The children consume human flesh with much relish. I tried it once. It was not to my taste.
From the journal of Doctor Henry West
In the Old Testament, it is Ahriman, the Terror That Stalks By Night. The Necronomicon calls it the Great Devourer.
The insectoid race that once inhabited the dead world of Formosa called it Y'siggthugga, and burned their entire planet to ash in sacrifice to it.
It is the Overlord of The Corrupted, and it will be the first to cross over when the Gateway is opened.
When the stars were right, They could plunge from world to world through the cosmos, consuming all. But when the stars were wrong, They are confined to the Abyss. Soon, the stars will be right again.
From the journal of Doctor Henry West

The moment grows near. The Time of Cosmic Alignment is only a few short weeks away. The Masters have promised me that the Sacrifice would manifest themselves, but still I wait. This moment has been decades in coming. Has it all been for nothing?
From the journal of Doctor Henry West

My theories in Necrobiology find little favor with the sensibilities of this modern age. There are protests and complaints. In previous centuries, they stoned me and drove me from town. In this age, they write protest emails to the college newspaper. I live in an age of naive innocents.
From the journal of Doctor Henry West

My work still requires subjects. The rituals require sacrifices. The creatures in my mansion require feeding. Luckily, the student population at the university is ample enough to provide me with everything I need.
From the journal of Doctor Henry West
They do not like my theories, but my cash is a different matter. I tell them the life essence-draining devices I hook them up to are a private research project.

They leave weakened and faint but fifty dollars richer. They spend the money on beer and pizza, no doubt. Poor compensation for the ten years or more that I have just stolen from their likely lifespan!
From the journal of Doctor Henry West - Arkham, 2009

My hand trembles, even as I record this. Today, in my office at Miskatonic, a young woman came to see me. Her name was Jennifer Willis, a student at the university. In looks and manner, she is the near-double of my beloved Leonora. The Masters were right. Fate has provided us with a Chosen Sacrifice.

I have known no friends, no close acquaintances , no human companionship for two and a half centuries now. I do not need such things. I have my work, and the assurance that my beloved will be returned to me.
I will offer up that girl's soul to the Masters, and her flesh will become my beloved's flesh.
From the journal of Doctor Henry West
All is as it should be. This girl Jennifer will die, so that my Leonora will live again.
When the Sacrifice is made, at the right time and in the appointed place, the gateway will open and the Masters will be released. Leonora will be returned to me, reborn in this other woman's flesh.
From the journal of Doctor Henry West, Arkham - 2010

The Alignment comes tomorrow. I have found the right bait to lure this woman to my mansion. There, I will carry her through the Portals, to enact a portion of the ritual at each of the places of power. Then comes the Sacrifice, and the opening of the Gateway. Nothing can go wrong!
From the journal of Doctor Henry West - Arkham, 2010

She is here! I hear her talking in the hallway below! She has brought another with her, against my instructions. Some feeble-minded boyfriend, no doubt. No matter. He will not save her. Nothing canâ€¦
R Rating? When we get home, let's you and I put on our own private NC-17 show.
Oh, scream all you want; I love it when they screamâ€¦
â€¦it makes it so much more fun!
I love it when they scream - I love it!
It don't take much for something good to go bad.

This is where it all began.
To save Jennifer Rick must fight to learn the dark secrets of resurrection.
It feeds on your desires and your fears, offering immortality, power - but at what cost? Dare you wear the Terror Mask?
Evil goes old-school in the mask that started it all.
Make every day The Day of the Dead.
Touched by the Corrupted, driven insane by an eternity in the Abyss.

Two lovers, Rick and Jen, are separated. She is taken, he is left to die; a man named West guilty of both crimes. Too late they learn that monsters are real. A mysterious mask offers Rick a chance for life, and for redemption; but at what cost?

Rick, transformed, pursues Jen and West through a dark house. A portrait of West's wife reminds Rick of his love; twins, separated by time and death. Some furniture is broken, a spirit is laid to rest, and a portal carries Jen into forever after.

The portal leads to a place that would once have seemed familiar, now alien and dead. Jennifer will die soon; an offering to older gods. The moon covers the face of the sun. The first lock is starting to open; the Corrupted are coming.

Rick learns humanity's fate, and his part in it; an abattoir for men; their meats all neatly stripped from their bones. But it might yet not be too late. Rick butchers the butcher; West and Jen slip through his fingers and into another portal.

The mask gains the upper hand. Between the Corrupted and West a covenant is made; freedom in return for a wife reborn. Deep underground the relics of dead religions whisper the secrets of the Abyss; the house dreams of being alive.

Rick begins to lose himself in the pleasure of blood spilt, and that little voice in his head knows it is winning. A monster haunts West Mansion. In West's laboratory an ambush is sprung, and a trapdoor is opened. Rick falls.

Lies are little cracks in the walls of the Abyss, and Rick has told more than a few. The mask was once a slave, and the Corrupted his masters. But there is one power the mask fears more than the ancient ones - love, my friend, love.

Mirrors reveal more than just a reflection. On the silver side Rick battles his many selves. What happens when a man kills his own mirror image? The moon is in shadow; the third lock is open. Rick and the mask travel on.

Rick and the mask uncover the dark heart of West mansion. A narrator tells the story of West's fall - from husband to widow, from surgeon to slaughterer, from God to the Devil. As the heart dies, a portal to the past is opened.

1866; by the sea a wooden man burns. Inside, a woman Rick mistakes for Jen; Leonora, West's undead wife. West prays to God, but the Devil answers. Two heroes race to save the women they love. By our story's end both are villains, and victims.

The fifth lock is open, and reality bows to a higher power; They are almost here. West makes a vow; he will smother man's pain in sweet extinction. He is willing to sacrifice all for love; perhaps West and Rick are not so different.

Too late Rick learns he has been deceived; 10,000 sacrifices, and him the executioner. In a body built by Rick's bloody hands the Corrupted liveâ€¦ and so can die; the mask takes his revenge. But Jen is not safe; Jen is not even Jenâ€¦

Rick Taylor and the Terror Mask are back, beating, tearing and slicing their way through hordes of the undead in a tale of love, mutilation and madness.
I want us to be together until the end of the world.

â€¦for without faith I am nothing...

To us. You're wearing me, I'minhabiting you. We're a team, now.

So the deal's a simple one:
You give me blood, I give you power; I make you stronger.

Ah man, it is good to finally be free...

From the journal of Doctor Henry West
My home has changed much since I first built it.
New wings and floors have been added, hidden cellars and dungeons excavatedâ€¦
...and out-buildings have grown up in the grounds around it.
It has its secrets, and it has guardians to protect those secrets.
Look around; there should be more.
Find them all and the dead will give up their secrets.
Blood ciphers - ancient symbolsof power, illuminated by blood.
I want us to be together until the end of the world.
Only thing you got left is your soulâ€¦
Who am I? Let's just say I'm God; your God...
...least, the only God that's listening right now.
What do I want? Ah, same as any God; a little faithâ€¦
â€¦for without faith I am nothing...
I can help you; I can heal your wounds.
We can save her, if you show me some faithâ€¦
...if you trust me, if you put me on...
You brought this on yourself Rick, but hang in there; it'll all be worth it in the end.
...did I say it was going to be fun?
You're going to have to learn to love the painâ€¦
...there's a lot more of it to comeâ€¦
What have you done to me?
What am I? What am I?
To us. You're wearing me, I'minhabiting you. We're a team, now.
You help me get what I want,and I help you get your girl back.
Come on - let's go kill something. It'sbeen too long, and I'm way outta practice.
Ooops! Too much for ya Rick-o?Shit, you humans are so fragile.
You're still weak; we'll have to...take it slower, build your strength.
I don't want to be stuck here for another two hundred years waiting for the next sucker to come along.
I gave you life Rick; what are you gonna give me in return?
Listen; I have a thirst Rick - call it a passion.
See, when it comes to blood I'msomething of a connoisseur, you know?
Type A is sweet and heady. B is thick, earthy; rich. AB is gritty - that's the iron - and O - Oh, oh, oh! O is to die for.
So the deal's a simple one:
You give me blood, I give you power; I make you stronger.
Unleash the power - give me blood.
You're getting stronger Rick; maybe it's time...
I think you're ready for a little more...
I can give you so much more Ricky-boy; you sure you can handle it?
See we're one and the same; the body and the brain.
What do you want this time?
You could have been anything Rick, but you chose this - a semi-naked fruity little muscle-man.
But it's not too late to change...
You have a choice, you always have a choice.
Remember Rick; Blood is precious. Blood is power. Blood is your life. Blood is your future.
I've given you the power, now show me you deserve it.
Ah man, it is good to finally be free...
Will you be quiet? You're going to-
They can't hear us Rick - this is all in your head...
The darkness Rick; it's all around us, always has been. You can see it now, through my eyes.
Looks just like your girl, don't she?
I know what your favorite movie is.I know what your favorite cereal is.
I know that when you're alone withthat pretty girl of yours, you love to-
Heheheheh! Then find more things for us to kill.
Blood and carnage alwaysmake me feel more cooperative.
Watch it Rick - you can't hurt it, but it can kill you.
Okay - Who the fuck threw that?
I said alright - who did that?
Oh great; Furniture - the lamest of all enemies.
West has quite the ego don't he?
Real classy. Christ, West's lack of taste is fucking staggering.
Welcome to Dr. West's handjob dungeon.
Zombies. Check these bad boys out; still in the original box.
Blood, blood, blood, blood, blood, blood, blood! I love it!
The pressure weakened the floor of the tube.
Aaaarghhh! Oh God! Oh! Oh my arm!
I asked you to trust me; first sightof blood you're crying like a schoolgirl.
For a Dick you are such a pussy.
You get hurt too bad and it's gameover; too much damage will kill us.
And when I say us, I mean you.
...I know these people; we tookstats together last semester.
Aww, and now you killed them.
West's experiments already broke theirminds. You're just crushing the shell.

And I suppose this is the glee club.
So who's this; your prom date?
I got a feeling this asshole was voted "most likely to be beat to fuckin' death."
Congratulations Rick - at last you've been crowned the prom queen.
To bad we have to kill her.
He's stunned; grab him - finish him.
What are you? I don't know anything about you.
You set me free. I owe you. That's all you need to know.
And somehow, I don't care.Heheh... Believe what you want.
Look, your girl's a movie star...
This bitch has been stirring up trouble since we started.
Yeah, so I see. Don't they make a cute fuckin' couple?
You still haven't told me what you are.
I'm why dogs howl in the night,I'm the salt in the tears your momma cried,I'm the match that sets the cross alight,I'm the phone call told you your sister died...
Stop it! Don't talk about my-
You fucker! Don't talk about my sister!
Getting closer. I can smell West.No mistaking that tang of insanity.
And that pretty girl of yours, I cansmell her too. Ooooww, she smells good.
Terror, confusion, panic. I like her.
"Doll'? Is that what you were going to say?
Poltergeist... they feed on the energy generated by young girls on the threshold of puberty.
...you're finally going to get your first period.
...you're finally going to grow pubes somewhere other than on your chin.
Let's see what you're made of.
Okay, now look what you did...
I think we pissed it off.
The floor's starting to give way!
That fucker's too heavy for this floor!
So hit it with something bigger!
Find something bigger to hit it with!
The doll's buried in there somewhere!
That doll is inside somewhere, we'll need to dig a hole and pull it out!
AHHH!! Almost there! Rip that doll out and show it who's boss!
You know what they say about big hands...
I don't think that's a pool of blood. Stepping in it's a real bad idea.
Gotta bring this pile of junk down somehow; might want to try getting under its feet!
YEAH! YEAH!! Rip the chest open!
You still don't trust me, do you Rick?
That's too bad; trusting me is the only chance you got.
Shh... Shh... It's over now; you're safe.
Is it possible..? I see it all now; aMoebius strip, without beginning or end.
No... too late, too late; hersoul must make room for another.
Enjoy what little extra life that thinghas given you and don't try to follow us.
You got one of those faces; now go!
Necrotic energy field's collapsed; magic door's closed, Rick...
...and we're going to have to kill something big to get it open again.
You said we needed to kill something big; will this do?
It just might Rick, it just might.

...to contain the life essence of one of the Masters.

...but living flesh is always easier to work with than dead.
From the journal of Doctor Henry West
The Masters' true forms cannot exist in this world.
They require host bodies, but what form, what kind of fleshâ€¦
...is strong enough to contain the terrible power of their life forces?
It will be the supreme challenge to build new bodies for them.
I remold flesh and resculpt bone.
I create things both unnatural and wondrous. I enjoy my work.
I have seen hundreds - thousands, more likelyâ€¦
...die before me on the surgeon's table.
Their gods did not answer their babbling prayers. Mine will.
Interesting place; who's the architect - Edgar Allan Poe?
And leave you alone in there with Dr. Weird?

...but he asked for me specially, remember?
Ha! Another one for my collection.
Rick Taylor: The man behind the mask'. That's the story I want to get.

You're strangely quiet. What's wrong - you all out of asshole comments?
I sought refuge in this temple; the only place those ghouls would dare not trespass.
This place; this place is death...
Jesus, I know you're just a mask, but have some balls.
Oh you're real fucking smart, aintcha? Think you're so-so special.
I got news for you Rick; you're just the latest meat-puppet. The only thing special about you is ME.
You're gonna die here, just like the others. You're going to die, Jenny's going to die, and there's nothing you can do to stop it.
Oh yes there were others... and they were stronger than you; driven by power, driven by greed.
They all failed. You think you're any better?
At its center stood a golden Sarcophagus oh! So beautiful I swear I could see the faces of angels beneath its surface.
Inside that casket: a mask of bone the sight of which did chill my blood. The creatures were greatly afraid of this thing. And in their fear I saw hope.
I would swear that mask called to me, offering a chance for escape, and for salvation.
"If you trust me," it whispered, "if you put me on..."And so I did...
A transformation, a face and a body that were not my own. A confusion of images, a hunger - and so much blood. I was lost.
...but not enough. For something else came; all horns and fury, immeasurably vast, awful.
That's really starting piss me off.
That thing is really pissing me off...
I was captured, condemned and imprisoned. The golden casket I had coveted would be mine now; now and forever...
I crave a death so long in coming; but this cursed mask torments me still. In time they shall learn what I have learned...
...the flesh is a dungeon for the soul.
I don't remember inviting two of you.
Oh, ah - Doctor Westâ€¦ I'm Jennifer Willis.
You contacted me about doing an interview for the student newspaper?
To give your side of the story about the work you're doing at the medical school?
Rick Taylor, sir. I hope you don't mindâ€¦
...but Jen and I have a date tonightâ€¦
...so it kinda made sense for me to just-
You wanted to protect your girlfriendâ€¦
The final eclipse is approaching; the gateway is almost open.
...our journey is drawing to a close.
It's unfortunate we have become adversaries.
We share so much - the same interests, the same purposeâ€¦
I warned you not to follow us; well... you know how impulsive young people are.
But I understand; you would do anything for Jennifer, just as I have done for Leonora.
What are a dozen lives, a hundred, ten thousand lives when measured against one true love?
And I have been admiring your excellent work in that regard.
I knew when I first saw you transformed by the Terror Maskâ€¦
...knew it was you who had killed Leonora.
And for an instant I thought perhaps this could all be undone.
But no, we are both being worked by unseen hands, like puppets in a shadow play.
Perhaps this means nothing to you now, but you will understand soon enough.
It's too late to go back - too late, too late.
Dr. West has left the planet.
What the hell is happening here?!
Things are getting weird; I mean weirder than normal.
The Corrupted are dreaming this world.
Soon they'll awaken, and this world will be gone.
The laws of science are bowing to a higher power; reason has failed.
I can feel some weird pull; some force centered way over there.
The altar! The sacrificial altar is on the other side of the chapel!
Jen's there; on the far side of the chapel, by the lake shore!
I can't see for shit in here!
Jesus! The world's coming apart at the seams!
If the good Lord Jesus is still planning on coming back he's got about twenty minutes.
Reality is terrified; logic has abandoned us.
It's the eclipse. We're running out of time!
The fabric of reality is unraveling.
Oh! Shit! Ah! These things HURT!
Of course; the sky is falling.
Could you try not to get us squashed by the giant falling meteorites?!
See the idea is to avoid being crushed. Got it?
Oh hell yes! You see that shit?!?!?!
What?! No comment? I just caught a FUCKING METEOR!
What does it take to impress you?!
Oh God, one second. Just let me catch my breath.
One-hundred and forty-four years ago I lost everything - no, you took it from me.
You took it all when you killed Leonora! You killed my wife!
Yes we did; what's your point?
No... this... this is all my fault.
Rick... have you forgotten what he's done to you - what he's done to Jenny?
That night I vowed that all men should suffer as I have suffered. But I was wrong.
Pain and suffering are born of life; that much is clear to me now.
So this is my gift to you, to all mankindâ€¦
...an end to all suffering, an end to all life.
Yes, the Corrupted will spare mankind any further painâ€¦
...and Leonora and I shall be reunited!
It's a little late to start praying now.
The mausoleum; West built this to honor his victimsâ€¦
...back when there was still a spark of humanity in him.
They're drawing power from the Abyss!
This is what mankind's always dreamed of Rick-o; the end of the world!
Congratulations. Is it everything you were hoping for?
Blood ciphers - ancient symbolsof power, illuminated by blood.
Look around; there should be more.
Find them all and the dead will give up their secrets.
Get your hands off my girl.
We did it, didn't we? We stopped the ceremony.
The eclipse is still in motionâ€¦
...something's still trying to force its way through!
It was inevitable, Rick. The sacrifice was already complete.
Jen was the bait; You Rick, you're the key.
One sacrifice isn't enough to open the gateway.
Not one, not one thousand, but ten thousand sacrifices!
And you Rick, you have been the executioner.
I want vengeance for an eternity of agonyâ€¦
You never meant to prevent this! You lied to me!
I want the corrupted to know that it was ME stopped them.
That my friend... is what will send daddy back home!
Don't get caught by that claw!
He's gonna drain our life force!
You can watch stars burn out and civilizations rise and fallâ€¦
...but when that payback finally comes roundâ€¦
...there's not a second of all that waiting that ain't been worth it.
Hey, Hey! What do you think you're doing?
Our deal was to save Jen; she's safe now.
You sure our deal's over, Rick-o?
You checked on your girl lately?
Leonora, my love! At last you've come back to meâ€¦
I'm here, Leonora. I've been waiting so long for you, my belovedâ€¦
The Corrupted are an abstraction - an idea. And ideas are unstoppable.
You interrupted the ritual that would have let'em out pure.
But they're still coming - trapped in a body made from the lives you took with your own two hands.
They're flesh and blood now, and all that lives must one day die...
They live; and all that lives must one day die.
You, West, your girl; you're all pieces in a game that's been playing out for a thousand years.
The Corrupted shall rule, in a body you built for them with your bare, bloody hands.
You have served us well Rick, and you will be rewarded. Power, wealth, women; you can have it all...
True love Rick; there's no power in this world or the next can defeat true love.
That you would rather die than betray Jen? Well, it moved me. You have taught me to value life, and treasure love.
I'm sorry; I can't keep it straight, I tried.
No, I need people; I need suffering, heartache and pain - and your suffering is especially sweet.
Besides, I got other plans for you. By the time we're done you're gonna wish you took me up on that offer.
Gonna let'em out? Not all of them Rick; not all of them.
You sure it's over, Rick-o? You checked on your girl yet?
Ohhhh you're as beautiful as I remember...

Tackle Pack: $BTN_R2 + press $BTN_FACE_RIGHT, then press any attack button.
Hold $BTN_R2 to sprint. Then press $BTN_FACE_LEFT, $BTN_FACE_UP or $BTN_FACE_RIGHT to attack.
Heavy Weapons (Chainsaw, Shotgun) prevent jumps, blocks and evades.
